arm_group.description: 29, 37, 46 and 54% of the mean Lysine requirement of 35 mg/kg/d will be given to subjects.

brief_summary.textblock:
Our objective is to determine the metabolic availability of Lysine  in white maize using the
      indicator amino acid oxidation (IAAO) technique.

clinical_study.brief_title: Metabolic Availability of Lysine From White Maize
clinical_study.condition: Lysine Bioavailability in White Corn Determined in Healthy Young Adult Men

detailed_description.textblock:
Our objective is to determine the metabolic availability of Lysine  in white maize. 7 young,
      healthy, male adults will receive graded levels (29, 37,46 and 54%) of lysine requirement of
      35 mg/kg/d as a crystalline AA mixture and a porridge of white cornmeal protein
      respectively.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Healthy Adult males (20-49 years old)

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  A history of recent weight loss or illness

          -  Use of any medication at the time of entry into the study

intervention.description: Crystaline Lysine from Amino Acid Mixture in amount of 29, 37, 46 and 54% of the mean Lysine requirement of 35 mg/kg/d will be given to subjects.
intervention.intervention_name: Crystaline Lysine from Amino Acid Mixture

intervention.description: A cornmeal porrodge including 29, 37, 46 and 54% of the mean Lysine requirement of 35 mg/kg/d will be given to subjects.

clinical_study.official_title: Application of the Indicator Amino Acid Oxidation Technique for the Determination of Metabolic Availability of Lysine From White Maize Protein, in Young Adult Men

other_outcome.description: 3 breath samples will be taken to provide a baseline F13CO2 measurement (Level of Phenylalanine oxidation). Breath samples will be collected and analyzed for 13CO2 enrichment.
other_outcome.time_frame: 30 mins after intake of the fourth hourly meal (before tracer infusion)

other_outcome.description: 3 breath samples will be taken to provide a baseline F13CO2 measurement (Level of Phenylalanine oxidation). Breath samples will be collected and analyzed for 13CO2 enrichment.
other_outcome.time_frame: 45 mins after intake of the fourth hourly meal (before tracer infusion)

other_outcome.description: 4 breath samples will be taken to provide F13CO2 measurement (Level of Phenylalanine oxidation). Breath samples will be collected and analyzed for 13CO2 enrichment.
other_outcome.time_frame: Post Tracer Infusion (between 150 and 240 min of tracer infusion)

overall_official.affiliation: The Hospital for Sick Children, Toronto, Canada

primary_outcome.description: 3 breath samples will be taken to provide a baseline F13CO2 measurement (Level of Phenylalanine oxidation). Breath samples will be collected and analyzed for 13CO2 enrichment.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Professor of Paediatrics and Nutritional Sciences (Emeritus) University of Toronto, Senior Scientist Research Institute, The Hospital for Sick Children

secondary_outcome.description: 3 breath samples will be taken to provide a baseline F13CO2 measurement (Level of Phenylalanine oxidation). Breath samples will be collected and analyzed for 13CO2 enrichment.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 15 mins after intake of the fourth hourly meal (before tracer infusion)

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Bio-availability Study, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Health Services Research
